    PMAY

    The PMAY is a Government backed Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS) wherein the mission is to provide affordable housing for all by the year 2022. The PMAY scheme offers its beneficiaries with subsidy, where the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana interest rate is charged at a subsidised or reduced rate than regular housing loans. This is done to make it possible for everyone to afford a home.

    What is a personal Loan?

    A Personal Loan is an unsecured credit that you can avail without pledging any collateral. Unlike other loans, a personal or unsecured loan has easy eligibility criteria, special offers and unrestricted end-use for you to finance your immediate expenses, be it a medical emergency or a foreign trip.

    Tata Capital provides easy Personal Loans available at attractive interest rates, starting at 10.99%.     Debt Consolidation

    Start a Small Business

    Lay the foundation for your small business without difficulty with Tata Capital's Personal Loan online. Instant approval and minimal documentation ensure you can get the funds faster and realise your entrepreneurial dream sooner.

    Make a Down Payment

    Struggling to arrange the down payment for the property you want to buy? With a Personal Loan online from Tata Capital, book your dream house without any difficulty. Get the required funds within minutes of approval and at competitive rates.
    Cover Relocation Charges

    From transportation charges to buying home essentials, moving from one city to another accompanies a slew of expenses. To make sure the process is easy on your pockets, get a Personal Loan from Tata Capital and repay the amount in flexible EMIs.

    What is the Importance of CIBIL Score for Personal Loan?

    CIBIL score, an important indicator of your credit health, is a three-digit number summarising your credit history, report, and rating. The score ranges from 300 to 900 and indicates your ability to repay your personal loan amount in a timely manner.

    CIBIL score plays a decisive role in the Personal Loan application process. When a self-employed or salaried individual approaches a financial institution for a loan, the lender checks the CIBIL score and report of the applicant. If your CIBIL score is low, it reduces your chances of getting the loan. The score also affects your loan interest rates, tenure, amount, and EMI. The higher the CIBIL score, the better.

    How much CIBIL Score is Required for a Personal Loan?

    A CIBIL score is a numerical summary of your repayment capacity. It is a 3-digit number, ranging between 300 to 900, which provides a snapshot of your past track record. As a result, the score is used to assess your creditworthiness and decide the terms of the loan.

    In case of a Personal Loan, where the amount is approved and advanced without collateral, your CIBIL score becomes a critical eligibility criterion. Typically, a CIBIL score above the 700 mark is considered good and attracts easy approval.

    However, to receive approval from Tata Capital, your CIBIL score for Personal Loan should ideally fall between X and Y. If you don't know your CIBIL score and are wondering if you're eligible, don't worry. We got you covered!

    What is a Pre-approved Personal Loan?

    When you receive a pre-approved offer for a Personal Loan, it simply means that the lender has evaluated your creditworthiness and agreed to advance a loan. So, you don't need to go through the initial stages of the application process, and receive a guaranteed loan in the least time possible. So the overall loan processing time becomes shorter.

    Generally, borrowers who have a spotless history of paying credit dues are eligible for instant pre-approved loans. However, other criteria like monthly income, credit score, age, etc., also play a decisive role.

    Got a high CIBIL score and a spotless credit history? Get a pre-approved Personal Loan from Tata Capital online.

    What are the Personal Loan EMI options available?

    • Standard EMI

    The standard EMI option under Personal Loans is one in which you get the freedom to pay off your principal loan amount inclusive of interest consistently on a monthly basis. Here, the interest is charged on the total principal amount that was borrowed. 

    • Step-Up Flexi Loan EMI

    A step-up flexi EMI option in Personal Loan is one which offers greater flexibility. Under this plan, you can pay lower EMIs in the beginning and pay more gradually as your salary hikes.

    To understand the repayment options available to you, visit our Personal Loan EMI options page

    FAQ
    What are the basic requirements to get your Personal Loan approved?

    Getting a Personal Loan is simple and quick. To get your loan approved swiftly, you will be asked to provide the following details: Your personal details including your PAN number, CIBIL score & KYC documents Copies of your pay slips, address proof and bank statements Find out more about Personal Loan Eligibility and Documents for more details.

    What is the maximum Personal Loan you are eligible for?

    We provide Personal Loans from a minimum of ₹ 75,000 to a maximum of ₹ 35,00,000/- depending on your eligibility.

    How much EMI do you need to pay?

    Your Equated Monthly Instalment depends on the principal loan amount, the interest rate charged and the period for which the loan is taken. You can choose your EMI amount that is comfortable for you by using the Personal Loan EMI calculator.

    How to calculate your EMI using our Personal Loan Calculator?

    Enter the following information to calculate your EMI:

    • Loan Amount (The loan amount you wish to get)
    • Personal Loan Interest Rate
    • Loan Tenure (Period ranges from 12 -84 months)
    • Click the Calculate button. The system shows your EMI monthly break-up of both the interest and principal payment.
    • If the Personal Loan EMI is higher or lower than you want to pay, edit the principal amount and follow the same steps from 2 to 4
    When should you opt for personal loan?

    Personal loans can be taken for a variety of different purposes, such as follows –

    • Travel – Strike off a dream location you have been craving to visit with an easy personal loan
    • Education – Give your child the quality education they deserve with a personal loan
    • Wedding – No other event in a person’s life is more special than a wedding. Throw a wedding of a lifetime by taking the aid of a personal loan
    • Medical – Need funds for a medical emergency? Opt for a personal loan to meet your urgent needs
    • Debt Consolidation – Need to meet other costlier loan repayments? A personal loan can help you out!
    Do you need any collateral for availing a personal loan?

    No, you do not need any collateral or security for availing a personal loan with Tata Capital.

    How long will it take for a personal loan application to get approved?

    Online personal loan applications can be approved within seconds to a few minutes of submission! Offline applications, on the other hand, may take a few business days from the date of submission for approval.

    Does personal loan affect your credit score?

    Much like any other form of credit, a personal loan also affects our credit score in the long-term and is a great opportunity to build good credit worthiness. Making consistent timely EMI payments and ultimately repaying off your personal loan within its fixed tenure will improve your future credit score

    Can you get tax benefits on personal loan?

    Yes, you can avail tax benefits on your personal loan depending upon the purpose for which the loan was taken. The Income Tax allows tax deductions for loans taken for education, purchase or renovation of property, and business expansion. For instance, as per Section 24 of the Income Tax Act, if you have taken a personal loan for home construction or renovation, the interest paid is eligible to be claimed as exemption from your taxable income. For self-owned houses, interest up to Rs. 2 lakhs is eligible for exemption whereas for rented houses, the entire interest can be claimed as tax exemption. In case of business expansion, the interest paid will be added to the cost of acquisition which will reduce capital gains, and thereby tax liability. Moreover, Section 80 E of the Income Tax Act speaks about the tax benefits up to Rs. 1,50,000 for those who have taken an education loan for higher studies.

    When is a personal loan a good idea?

    One of the biggest personal loan benefits is that it can help you arrange funds for any purpose. If you need money for a medical emergency or a last-minute trip, a loan can help you. Or, if your savings are locked in investments but you need cash, take a personal loan. Apply online with zero paperwork and enjoy quick disbursal.
